The stanza has to be said four times. During the first Yatāhūwairyō he has to turn the pestle over around the mortar in the direction in which the sun rotates. During the first Yatāhūwairyō, he has to strike (with the pestle) once at š́iiaōθananąm, once at aŋhə̄uš and once at mazdāi. During the second, he has to strike twice each time at the same words and during the third Yatāhūwairyō, three times each time at the same words so that they are three times during the first, six during the second and 9 during the third. At the third xšaθrəmcā, he has to raise the pestle to the height of the ears. During the fourth Yatāhūwairyō, he has to strike continuously .
